page.title: 12ENERGY , OIL , INDUSTRY
page.content: The Immingham Oil Terminal is situated at the North Eastern corner of the dock complex and has berthing accomodation for four vessels. The outer jetty can take two vessels each up to 250,000 tons and the inner jetty two of 35,000 tons. The jetty extends 366 metres into the Humber and was built to serve the interests of the oil refineries. Oil is imported from the Persian Gulf, North Africa, Holland, Germany and Belgium. The draught at the oil terminal is 13.1 m which means that although vessels of 250,000 tons are berthed they can only be partly loaded. (about 110,000 tons)
